fields.description:
Steps

*What happened...*

*What should have happened...*

fields.description:
h3. Steps
 # Go to Edit mode of a page
 # Select "JIRA issue/filter" from macro selector in tool bar
 # Click "JIRA Charts" in the dialog
 # Click "Select Macro"
 # Search for "Issue Statistics" chart, select it
 # Fill out the configuration fields
 # Click "Save", the chart renders in the preview area
 # Click "Insert"

*What happened...* 
 User is returned to edit mode but the gadget is not there.

*What should have happened...*
 The gadget should have been added to the page.
h3. Notes

This may not be particular to the selected Macros, and might happen on other combinations as well.
h3. Workaround

Insert the desired macro directly by searching for it from the Macro Menu > Other Macros, instead of changing from the first to the second as per the steps.
fields.summary: Macro not inserted after choosing a different macro

fields.description:
h3. Steps
 # Go to Edit mode of a page.
 # Select "JIRA issue/filter" from macro selector in tool bar
 # Click "JIRA Charts" in the dialog.

h3. What happened

The screen flashes and changes to JIRA Charts, but on first glance it looks like nothing happened so it looks like it didn't work.
h3. What should have happened

It should be more obvious that it worked.
fields.summary: Changing to Jira Chart from Jira Filter (or vice versa) is confusing

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cursor focus is not automatically set in the text area when mentioning user in Chrome.
 This problem was reproduced only in case that we mentioned users from the navigation menu _+ > User mention_. (If we mention users with "@" shortcut, the problem is not reproduced.)
h3. Environment
 * Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start to edit a page
 # Click _+ > User mention_

h3. Expected Results

Cursor focus should be automatically set in the text area as in other browsers.
h3. Actual Results

Cursor focus was not automatically set in the text area. We need to click inside of the text area to input the user name.
!cursor.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

This problem seemed to be originally reported in -CONFSERVER-38633- but it was closed as "Obsolete".
h3. Workaround

Use other browsers like Firefox.
fields.summary: Cursor focus is not automatically set in the text area when mentioning user in Chrome

fields.description:
Due to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-4955, licensed users will inherit the same permissions of the anonymous users. If the "Can Use" is not marked for Anonymous Access, Confluence should not allow changes on Space Permissions.

If a specific page has the "view" permission enabled for anonymous users, users and groups that don't have permission to view the space will be able to view it since they will inherit the same permissions of the anonymous users, although the global 'can use' has not been enabled.

h6.how to replicate

# Go to the *Global Permissions* page.
# Ensure that "Anonymous Access" doesn't have 'can use' permission.
# Create a new space.
# Grant "view" permission for the 'confluence-administrators' group.
# Grant "view" permission for the anonymous users.
# Create a new test user member of the 'confluence-users' group.
# Access the newly created space.

With the above test, only the 'confluence-administrators' users should have view permission, however, regular users will also have 'view' permissions because they are inheriting the permission from the anonymous user. Note that the "Anonymous Access" is not enabled.

The best way to avoid that is blocking the action to edit anonymous permissions in case Anonymous Access is not enabled.
fields.summary: Block Space Permissions for anonymous users if 'Can Use' permission is not enabled

fields.description:
h3. User Scenario:
 # Browse space and select some special Page
 # Click 'Create' button to add new page
 # Decide not to save page and click Close link
 # As the result Confluence 6.4.3 redirects User to the 'Recently worked on' page

I suggest that for many users expected behaviour is to get to the Page from step 1.

Is it possible to change system behavior or setup some application option\variable to manage the place to be redirected to ('Recently worked on' or 'Latest visited page')?

 
h3. Note:

This behavior has only been observed after 'Recently worked on' feature was introduced in Confluence 6.3

When clicking Close link on earlier versions, system would redirect back to 'Latest visited page'.
fields.summary: Redirect to 'Recently worked on' page is confusing after Create and Close

fields.description:
h4. Steps to replicate # Access Confluence using IE 11 # Create a new page # Drag and drop the image to the Confluence editor # Save the page h4. *Expected Result*  The image should not be blurred h4. *Actual Result*  The image is blurred as per attached below : !testImage.jpg|thumbnail! *Workaround* : +Option 1+: Edit the page and click on the image itself to change any of the settings marked in red then, then change back to the desired setting and save the page again as per the screenshot below : !testImage2.jpg|thumbnail! +Option 2+: Use a different web browser other than IE to upload images to the page while editing h3. Notes Comparing the Storage Format of the page you will see: * Chrome {code:java}

{code} * Internet Explorer {code:java}

{code} This also affects Microsoft Edge Version 81.0.416.68 (Official build) (64-bit).   h3. Mass clean-up Run the following SQL statement to replace the {{ac:thumbnail="true"}} value with a blank value in all pages and all previous versions of pages including drafts: {code:sql|title=works on Postgres} UPDATE BODYCONTENT SET body = replace(body,'ac:thumbnail="true"','') WHERE body LIKE '%ac:thumbnail="true"%'; {code} {code:sql|title=works on MS SQL} UPDATE BODYCONTENT SET BODY = REPLACE (CONVERT(VARCHAR(MAX), BODY), 'ac:thumbnail="true"','') WHERE BODY LIKE '%ac:thumbnail="true"%'; {code} (!) Always make a full backup of the database and be prepared to roll back before directly editing the db.  When done with the search and replace statement above, go to *General Configuration -> Cache Management -> "Advanced View"* and click *"Flush All"* at the very bottom of the page. This is so cached versions of pages which have this code still in their storage format will be reloaded from the database at next page visit. You may need to clear browser cache as well or hold down shift+refresh on the page to load the page not from existing browser cache.  (i) Note: using Internet Explorer to upload new images into pages moving forward will embed the {{ac:thumbnail="true"}} value again. This can be avoided by resizing the image to anything else while editing, then resizing back to the size you want before saving the page.
fields.summary: Image is blurred when attaching it using IE11

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Confluence currently only auto saves the latest copy of the editing draft. It would be nice to roll back to a previously time stamp saved draft.
h3. Suggested Solution

Similar to Google Docs, provide a means to select an auto saved Draft date stamp to roll back to.
h3. Why this is important

Makes it easier to revert unwanted changes.
fields.summary: Allow rolling back to drafts based on timestamps

fields.description:
h3. Environment

MacOS Sierra +
h3. Steps
 # Edit content
 # Click spacebar twice after a word

h3. What happened

In Safari, 2 spaces = correct fullstop. In Chrome 2 spaces = misplaced fullstop " . ". In Firefox 2 spaces = does nothing but put in 2 spaces.
h3. What should have happened

Chrome should not produce the poorly formatted fullstop. We need to decide also what should be the expected behavior. Should all browsers do the same thing.
h3. Analysis

This is a MacOS Sierra feature. It looks like Firefox is ignoring it and Chrome is doing the wrong thing with it. This is not a TinyMCE issue.
h3. Workaround

The feature can be disabled in Mac > System Preferences -> Keyboard -> Text , then tick "Add Period with double-space"
fields.summary: Double tapping space bar produces inconsistent results

fields.description:

h2. What happened

The note overlaps the image.

!Screen Shot 2017-10-30 at 3.29.53 pm.png|width=485,height=178!
h2. What should have happened

The note should not overlap the image.
h2. Note

This likely affects other macros.
fields.summary: Note Macro spans across right-aligned image

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce:
 # Put cursor at the beginning of a new line
 # Change text color
 # Type some stuff
 # Press enter to go to next line and type some more

h4. Expected behavior:
Text will still be the changed color.

h4. Actual behavior:
Text changes back to the previous color. 
Note: doesn't seem to be an issue if you change the text color in the middle of a line. Only at the beginning of a line?

h4. Other unexpected behavior:
When collaboratively editing in 6.4, it seems like text color persistence can behave sporadically as well. (Maybe it also happens when not collaborating, but haven't seen it) Some example behaviors:
* Can't change the text color at all at the beginning of a line
* Changed text color and started typing in that color, but after a couple seconds, the whole line suddenly changes color while you're typing
* Someone else types something in a different color. I go to type something on a different line. Another line of seemingly unrelated colored text suddenly turns a different/previous color
fields.summary: Text color changed at the beginning of a line doesn't persist after pressing enter to go to the next line

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When pages have a significant number of previous versions, indexing will index all of them and cause delays with overall indexing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with significant number of previous versions (in this case 340k)

h3. Expected Results
# Indexing will not be affected by the number of previous versions of a page and indexing will proceed normally

h3. Actual Results
Indexing continues for a long periods of time depending on the number of historical versions and delay the index from completing for the entire instance.
# Logs and DEBUG logging do not reveal explicit errors with index
# Thread dumps show that most of the indexing threads are working on {{getVersionHistorySummary}}:

{noformat}
"Caesium-1-1" daemon prio=5 tid=0x00000000000000fa nid=0 runnable 
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.lang.Object.<init>(Object.java:37)
[...]
com.atlassian.confluence.core.persistence.hibernate.ContentEntityObjectHibernateDao.getVersionHistorySummary(ContentEntityObjectHibernateDao.java:344)
{noformat}

h3. Notes
* Interested to know why historical versions of a page are included in the indexing process

h3.Workaround
# Delete the page with the large page history
# Or make a copy of the page with a large history
## Then delete the original that has the history
## Rename the copy to remove "Copy" from the title
fields.summary: Indexing page history causes large page histories to take up threads and delay index completion

fields.description:
h1. Problem:

While the bug CONFSERVER-36018: Duplicates in the People Directory due to duplicates in the user_mapping table (fixed in Confluence Server 5.10.0) has been resolved, the duplicated users still exist in Confluence database.


 As per the update provided in the bug report:
{quote}UPDATE
 This bug no longer causes duplicates in the people directory because we have hack/patch to hide duplicates on that page, even if duplicates exist in the index. However, dups still appear in @ mentions and other places.When dups show in @ mentions, the dup will show as "Unknown user (<username>) (<username>)
{quote}
The process of cleaning the database of duplicated users includes exhaustive SQL queries, and the SQL queries sometimes does not work due to differences between database usages and Confluence versions.
h1. Suggestions

It'll be great if we include some kind of tool to "cleanup" the database in the application. We can add a "hidden" admin function just like "Rebuild Ancestor Table" action ([Rebuilding the Ancestor Table - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/rebuilding-the-ancestor-table-153948.html])

Is it possible to place a null constraint on lower_username? And potentially username as well? Currently there are no null constraints on this table.

Another fix that would be ideal is to fix the user indexing upgrade task so that it handles null values gracefully, and performs this operation to remove them.
fields.summary: Automated process to cleanup duplicate users in the database
Unpublished changes alert even after update

fields.description:
Macro header shows garbled text and weird symbols in Linux. Captcha appears warped and unreadable.

h6. Environment
 # Linux distributions, especially RedHat (RHEL)  and CentOS
 # Confluence v6 and above

h6. Steps to reproduce
 # Insert any macro having a title, like the Panel Macro

h6. Expected Behavior
Macro header (the name of the macro) renders properly

h6. Actual Behavior
Strange characters appear in place of the macro name.

!macro-garbled.png|thumbnail!

h6. Workaround
# Stop Confluence
# Make one or both of the following changes:
#* Uninstall lyx-fonts package (Lyx/MathML fonts - A collection of Math symbol fonts for lyx) if it is installed on the server
#* Ensure the following fonts are installed:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
yum install ghostscript
yum install dejavu-fonts-common
yum install dejavu-sans-fonts
yum install dejavu-sans-mono-fonts
yum install motif
{code}
 (!) some versions of ghostscript package can be affected by security vulnerability CVE-2018-16509 discovered in September 2018. 

for more details see

 https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16509
 https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-16509
https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/45369/

# Rebuild the font cache by using the following command:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
fc-cache -s
{code}
# Clear the plugin cache as described at  [How to clear Confluence plugins cache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-clear-confluence-plugins-cache-297664846.html]
# Rebuild the content index as described at [How to Rebuild the Content Indexes From Scratch on Confluence Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-rebuild-the-content-indexes-from-scratch-on-confluence-server-110035351.html]
# Start Confluence
# Clear browser cache and verify fonts are displayed correctly

h6. Notes
Confluence requires some fonts to work in Linux distributions that are not included in the installation package or in the documentation as a requirement.

In some cases, the workaround also works for file previews such as Office files and PDF.
fields.summary: Confluence UI shows garbled or corrupt text on CAPTCHA, macros and/or diagrams due to missing fonts in Linux

fields.description:
h3. Summary
REST API will not work when the parameter contains slash "/".
For example, GET membership REST API URI will not work if the group contains slash "/".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group that contains slash, for example "group/1"
# Try to list out its members using REST API. 

h3. Actual Result:
# <confluence base_URL>/rest/api/group/group/1/member ---> Gives 400 error.  
# <confluence base_URL>/rest/api/group/group%2F1/member ---> Gives 400 error.
# <confluence base_URL>/rest/api/group/group%252F1/member ---> Gives 0 members

h3. Notes
The issue happens because  Tomcat actually intentionally prevents URL decoding of / for some kind of security reason:
* https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-8.0-doc/config/systemprops.html#Security 

h3.Workaround
Add the following in the JVM argument:
{code}
-Dorg.apache.tomcat.util.buf.UDecoder.ALLOW_ENCODED_SLASH=true
{code}

More information on setting up JVM Arguments: [Configuring System Properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-system-properties-168002854.html]
fields.summary: Unable use any values that contains a slash as a parameter in REST API

fields.summary: Order Page Template

fields.description:
Hi,
 It seems latest confluence is tracking inline comments as page history. So we have lots of page changes it seems but in fact reality is that it is only inline comments from people. Further when actually editing the page, at the top left it is showing as "xyz is also editing the page" when in fact they are just commenting the page.

This results in the fact that when a user saves the page, the inline comments added to the page after the page entered edit mode till the page is saved are all lost because confluence says that there is conflicts and cannot resolve them even in fact there are no conflicts because the others are just commenting text which has not been changed or deleted.
fields.summary: Inline Comments appearing in Page History

fields.description:
h2. Steps
 # Create a page.
 # Add edit restrictions to it.
 # Notice the lock icon is grey and unlocked.
 # Refresh the page.
 # Notice the lock icon is now red and unlocked (*which is wrong*).
 # Click it to edit restrictions.
 # Notice the icon has changed to gray.

h2. Expected

The Page Restrictions icon should not change (grey unlocked). Red unlocked means the page inherits restrictions from other pages.

This is behaviour prior to the introduction of the bug:
||Restriction||Icon||
|None|Grey unlocked|
|Edit restriction only|Grey unlocked|
|Inherited view restriction|Red unlocked|
|Page view restriction|Red locked|

This might require a UX review. Documentation: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-restrictions-139414.html]
fields.summary: Page Restrictions icon is red unlocked instead of grey unlocked when Editing is restricted

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There is no Confluence *session* endpoint to be called for cookie authentication as the one for JIRA documented in:
- [Cookie-based auth for REST APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-cookie-based-authentication/]

h3. Workaround

If you have JIRA and Confluence on the same instance then you can call the JIRA session endpoint and, if the credentials used to authenticate the request have Confluence application access, you can use the cookie you retrieved to authenticate Confluence REST API calls.
fields.summary: It would be nice to have a session endpoint to call for Cookie authentication in Confluence as well

fields.description:
Page properties Report does not populate the Table of Content macro nested in Page Properties
h5. Step to reproduce:
 # Create a page called Parent Page. Use [^Parent Page.txt] for its Storage Format
 # Create the child page the Parent Page and use [^Child Page.txt] for its Storage Format
 # Label the Child Page as "test1"

h5. Expected Behavior

Page Properties Report should populate Table of Content details in List once you save the page. 
h5. Actual Behavior

The list of content only populated in Page Properties Report preview mode, but not after you save the page

!Page Properties Report.png|thumbnail!

 

*Workaround*

Add table of contents macro within an excerpt macro outside of the property macro, and then use an except include within the property macro. 

!image-2020-07-22-11-35-09-699.png|width=334,height=333!

!image-2020-07-22-11-37-07-054.png|width=673,height=189!
fields.summary: Page Properties Report does not populate Table of Content macro

fields.description:
Some Oracle-backed Confluence instances might encounter a fatal error when being upgraded from lower versions to 5.9 or later. Error messages shown in the logs:
{code:java}
2017-06-15 16:18:54,597 ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate] execute Unsuccessful: alter table USER_RELATION add constraint FK_U2URELATION_LASTMODIFIER foreign key (LASTMODIFIER) references user_mapping
2017-06-15 16:18:54,598 ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate] execute ORA-02267: column type incompatible with referenced column type

2017-06-15 16:18:54,598 ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate] execute could not complete schema update
java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-02267: column type incompatible with referenced column type

	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:450)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:399)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.processError(T4C8Oall.java:1059)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.receive(T4CTTIfun.java:522)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.doRPC(T4CTTIfun.java:257)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.doOALL(T4C8Oall.java:587)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CStatement.doOall8(T4CStatement.java:210)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CStatement.doOall8(T4CStatement.java:30)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CStatement.executeForRows(T4CStatement.java:931)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.doExecuteWithTimeout(OracleStatement.java:1150)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.executeUpdateInternal(OracleStatement.java:1707)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.executeUpdate(OracleStatement.java:1670)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatementWrapper.executeUpdate(OracleStatementWrapper.java:310)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyStatement.executeUpdate(NewProxyStatement.java:410)
	at net.sf.hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate.execute(SchemaUpdate.java:167)
	at bucket.core.persistence.hibernate.schema.SchemaHelper.updateSchemaIfNeeded(SchemaHelper.java:173)
	at bucket.core.persistence.hibernate.schema.SchemaHelper.updateSchemaIfNeeded(SchemaHelper.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager.upgrade(AbstractUpgradeManager.java:139)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.PluginFrameworkContextListener.launchUpgrades(PluginFrameworkContextListener.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.PluginFrameworkContextListener.contextInitialized(PluginFrameworkContextListener.java:77)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:4853)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.startInternal(StandardContext.java:5314)
	at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase.start(LifecycleBase.java:145)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.addChildInternal(ContainerBase.java:753)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.addChild(ContainerBase.java:729)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHost.addChild(StandardHost.java:717)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.HostConfig.deployDirectory(HostConfig.java:1092)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.HostConfig$DeployDirectory.run(HostConfig.java:1834)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{code}
h1.  Root cause

This is caused by a breaking change introduced back in 5.5 in which we updated Hibernate default dialect for Oracle DBMS from *net.sf.hibernate.dialect.Oracle9Dialect* to *net.sf.hibernate.dialect.OracleIntlDialect.* The former maps String to Oracle VARCHAR2 while the latter maps it to NVARCHAR2. This mismatch will cause troubles when we try to create any foreign keys from new NVARCHAR2 columns to old VARCHAR2 columns or vice versa. Some of our upgrade tasks in 5.9 do exactly this.

Not all Oracle-backed instances are affected by this bug because the dialect change just applied to new installations. Only when you updated the dialect manually to *OracleIntlDialect* in confluence.cfg.xml.
h1. How to check if your instances are affected by this bug?

You will be affected by this bug if all below conditions are met
 # Your instance has been *using Oracle* ever since.
 # Your instance was setup using a version *smaller than 5.5* e.g. 5.4, 2.5, etc...
 # You've updated Hibernate dialect to use *net.sf.hibernate.dialect.OracleIntlDialect* in <CONFLUENCE_HOME_DIR>/*confluence.cfg.xml*
 # You're trying to upgrade Confluence either

||From version||To version||
|Any versions smaller than 5.9.1|5.9.1 or later|
|5.9.1 or 5.9.2|5.9.3 or later|

h1. Workaround

There are 2 options (please restore your database to pre-upgrade state before applying any of these):
 # Just revert the Hibernate dialect to use *net.sf.hibernate.dialect.Oracle9Dialect* in <CONFLUENCE_HOME_DIR>/confluence.cfg.xml then run the upgrade as normal. Highly recommended, but only do this if you *have no plan to upgrade Confluence to version 6.1 or higher before this bug is properly fixed*.
 # Run a set of queries to convert existing text columns from VARCHAR2 to NVARCHAR2. See [https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/confluence-upgrade-fails-because-oracle-could-not-complete-schema-update-838275652.html]. There will be some failed queries because of existing foreign key constraints, you need to disable them first, convert the columns then enable them again.
fields.summary: Confluence instances using Oracle DBMS may not be able to upgrade to version 5.9 and later

fields.description: h3. Summary A link contains no text. An anchor element has an href attribute, but contains no text (or only spaces) and no images with alternative text. The purpose of each link (or form image button or image map hotspot) can be determined from the link text alone, or from the link text and its context (e.g., surrounding paragraph, list item, table cell, or table headers). Links (or form image buttons) with the same text that go to different locations are readily distinguishable. Empty links on the main dashboard: * * * h3. Why It Matters If a link contains no text, the function or purpose of the link will not be presented to the user. This can introduce confusion for keyboard and screen reader users. How to Fix It Remove the empty link or provide text within the link that describes the functionality and/or target of that link. h3. Reference [https://webaim.org/standards/wcag/checklist#sc2.4.4]
fields.summary: Section 508 - Empty Links

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A button is empty or has no value text. A <button> element is present that contains no text content (or alternative text), or an <input type="submit">, <input type="button">, or <input type="reset"> has an empty or missing value attribute.

Empty buttons from the main dashboard:
 * <button aria-controls="transition-saved-for-later" data-aui-trigger="" class="onboarding-hotspot" resolved=""></button>
 * <button title="Remove from My Spaces" class="remove toggle-favourite aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-star" style=""></button>

h3. Why It Matters

When navigating to a button, descriptive text must be presented to screen reader users to indicate the function of the button.
h3. How to Fix It

Place text content within the <button> element or give the <input> element a value attribute.
h3. Reference

[https://webaim.org/standards/wcag/checklist#sc2.4.4]
 [https://webaim.org/standards/wcag/checklist#sc1.1.1]
fields.summary: Section 508 - Empty Buttons

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A form control does not have a corresponding label.

An <input> (except types of image, submit, reset, button, or hidden), <select>, or <textarea> does not have a properly associated label text. A properly associated label is:
* a <label> element with a for attribute value that is equal to the id of a unique form control
* a <label> element that surrounds the form control, does not surround any other form controls, and does not reference another element with its for attribute
* a non-empty title attribute, or
* a non-empty aria-labelledby attribute.

Missing labels:
* Dashboard: <input id="quick-search-submit" class="quick-search-submit" type="submit" value="Search"/>
* People Directory: <input id="queryString" name="queryString" type="text" size="30" class="text" value="">
* Space Directory: <input id="space-search-query" name="queryString" type="text" placeholder="Filter" autocomplete="off" class="text">

h3. Why It Matters
If a form control does not have a properly associated text label, the function or purpose of that form control may not be presented to screen reader users. Form labels also provide visible descriptions and larger clickable targets for form controls.

h3. How to Fix It
If a text label for a form control is visible, use the <label> element to associate it with its respective form control. If there is no visible label, either provide an associated label, add a descriptive title attribute to the form control, or reference the label(s) using aria-labelledby. Labels are not required for image, submit, reset, button, or hidden form controls.

h3. Reference
https://webaim.org/standards/508/checklist#standardn
fields.summary: Section 508 - Missing Form Labels

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Image alternative text is not present (an image does not have an alt attribute).

Impacted elements from the main dashboard: 
* /images/icons/profilepics/default.png
* /system-template-resources/assets/images/welcome.png

h3. Why It Matters

Each image must have an alt attribute. Without alternative text, the content of an image will not be available to screen reader users or when the image is unavailable.

h3. How to Fix It

Add an alt attribute to the image. The attribute value should accurately and succinctly present the content and function of the image. If the content of the image is conveyed in the context or surroundings of the image, or if the image does not convey content or have a function, it should be given empty/null alternative text (alt="").

h3. Reference
https://webaim.org/standards/508/checklist#standarda
fields.summary: Section 508 - Missing Alternative Text

fields.description: h3. Summary Skip navigation links exist, but the targets for the links either do not exist or the links are not keyboard accessible. An in-page link contains the words "skip" or "jump" and is hidden with CSS display:none or visibility:hidden, or the link has an href attribute that does not match the id value of another element within the page or the name attribute value of an anchor element within the page. Broken links on the main dashboard: * Skip to content * Skip to breadcrumbs * Skip to header menu * Skip to action menu * Skip to quick search h3. Why It Matters A link to jump over navigation or jump to the main content of the page assists keyboard users only if the link is properly functioning and is keyboard accessible. h3. How to Fix It Ensure that the target for the link exists and that the link is not hidden with CSS display:none or visibility:hidden. h3. Reference [https://webaim.org/standards/508/checklist#standardo]
fields.summary: Section 508 - Broken skip links

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The language of the document is not identified.
The <html lang> attribute is missing or is empty.
The language of the page is identified using the HTML lang attribute (<html lang="en">, for example).

h3. Why It Matters
Identifying the language of the page allows screen readers to read the content in the appropriate language. It also facilitates automatic translation of content.

h3. How to Fix It
Identify the document language using the <html lang> attribute (e.g., <html lang="en">).

https://webaim.org/standards/wcag/checklist#sc3.1.1
fields.summary: Section 508 - Document language missing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to get an evaluation key, Confluence prompts you to enter your Marketplace credentials.  After entering your credentials, the credential dialog box disappears, then a blank one appears momentarily but then disappears thus preventing you from reaching the "Get License" dialog.

h3. Environment
* Tested with Confluence 5.10.8 and 5.8.18 
* UPM versions 2.21.3 and 2.21.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select a plugin for evaluation and click on "Free Trial"
# Confluence displays an "Account log in" dialog box
# Enter your Marketplace credentials and hit enter
#  This dialog goes away and then another empty one appears, but then disappears.

h3. Expected Results
Confluence should display the "Get License" dialog after clicking "Free Trial"

h3. Actual Results
You can't get a license key for the evaluation as Confluence does not appear to accept your credentials.
 
h3.Workaround
In version 5.10, upgrade to UPM 2.22.6.   Note, this option is not available for 5.8.18 as the highest compatible version of UPM is 2.21.5.  Instead, for  versions < 5.10, you would need to get an evaluation key directly off the plug in vendor's Marketplace site and enter that into the downloaded plugin listed within "Manage addins".
fields.summary: Unable to generate an evaluation license key after adding a plug in

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing very large tables in Confluence, any text that is input lags a couple of seconds behind after input.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6+
* Collaborative Editing enabled
* IE11 (this browser is the slowest from testing)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure collaborative editing is running
# Create a page with a table + text that is ~300 rows
# Edit one of the cells

h3. Expected Results
Minimal lag between input and editor displaying the text

h3. Actual Results
The text input takes a couple of seconds to show up, and the cursor sometimes freezes. The browser can also crash.
 
h3. Notes
This has been tested with Chrome and Firefox, and although there is lag it is still usable. With IE it is much slower. Increasing Synchrony memory helps a improve the performance but not by much but it looks like the biggest contributor to the slowness is network lag and type of browser.

If this is tested on the same machine where Confluence/Synchrony are running, the lag is less noticeable. If tested from a different machine on IE11 the application takes a long time to respond and sometimes crashes.

h3.Workaround
Disable collaborative editing
fields.summary: Large tables are slow to respond with collaborative editing enabled

h3. Summary
Installing Confluence on Windows as a service will not add org.apache.tomcat.websocket.DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE as a startup parameter. And that will cause large "paste" of text to temporarily throw exception and brake Collaborative editing for that page.

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.4.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Install Confluence on Windows as a service.

h3. Expected Results
Service will have org.apache.tomcat.websocket.DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE as a default startup parameter.

h3. Actual Results
Service will not have org.apache.tomcat.websocket.DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE as a startup parameter.
 
h3. Notes
Setenv.bat has this startup parameter by default.

h3.Workaround
Add this startup parameter to [Windows service|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/start-confluence-automatically-on-windows-as-a-service-172071.html]
{code}
-Dorg.apache.tomcat.websocket.DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE=32768
{code}
fields.summary: Install Confluence on windows will not set org.apache.tomcat.websocket.DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE as startup parameter for service.

fields.description:
When trying to import a space, I get the error
"
 * Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page.

"

When I debugged confluence (hitting the error in com.atlassian.xwork.interceptors.XsrfTokenInterceptor#intercept:90) that's actually not correct. The true error (in ServletActionContext.getRequest().errors), that's being masked by this no token error, is a "java.io.IOException: Content Length Error (2147487250 > 2147483647)"

I think a few customers are experiencing this problem too

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/import-space-and-site-fails-a-required-security-token-was-not/qaq-p/173733]

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Required-Security-Token-was-not-present-in-request/qaq-p/24631]

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Questions/Importing-and-Exporting-Spaces-from-Confluence-getting-a/qaq-p/422920]

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Required-security-token-when-restoring-from-backup/qaq-p/137169]
h2. Done When
 * Showing users the correct error

fields.description:
*STEPS TO REPLICATE*
 # Install Confluence version 6.4.2 (using *atlassian-confluence-6.4.2.tar.gz* for this test)
 # During the database setup, *Driver Class Name* is automatically set to use {{com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver}} as per screenshot below:
 !databasesetup.png|thumbnail!
 # Enter the database URL and credential.
 # Complete the installation.

*EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR*
User able to create a page after the installation.

*ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR*
Stack trace below appear in Confluence <HOME_directory>/logs/*atlassian-synchrony.log*:
{code:java}
2017-10-20 21:40:11,815 DEBUG [197:StdOutHandler [/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_102.jdk/Contents/Home/jre/bin/java]] Could not load driverClass net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.Driver
2017-10-20 21:40:11,815 DEBUG [197:StdOutHandler [/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_102.jdk/Contents/Home/jre/bin/java]] java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.Driver
{code}
User unable to create/edit page:
 !erroredit.png|thumbnail!

*WORKAROUND*
update the jtds url to a correctly formatted Microsoft SQL Server driver url as per their documentation ([https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/connect/jdbc/building-the-connection-url]) :
 # *Stop Confluence*
 # Navigate to Confluence <HOME_directory>/*confluence.cfg.xml* file and replace the line below:
{code:java}
<property name="hibernate.connection.url">jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://localhost:1433/confluence</property>
{code}
with:
{code:java}
<property name="hibernate.connection.url">jdbc:sqlserver://localhost:1433;databaseName=confluence</property>
{code}

 # *Start Confluence*
fields.summary: Unable to create/edit page after a fresh installation of Confluence with MS SQL Server. Synchrony could not load driverClass net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.Driver

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Large or Enterprise clients using the built-in Confluence SAML plugin (in Confluence Data Center 6.1+) may need the ability to map a different user attribute to the SAML response for NameID, if they cannot change this on the provider side.

For example, in the case where the SAML IdP has mapped NameID to the user email:
{code:java}
<saml:NameID Format=\"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:transient\">username@example.com</saml:NameID>
{code}
 * If the Confluence username is not also 'username@example.com' the SAML response will be rejected by Confluence, as that email address doesn't exist as a username in the Confluence database.
 * If there is a Confluence username for 'username@example.com' then the SAML response will allow this user to login to Confluence.

Some IdP providers, or some companies subscribed to an IdP provider, may not have the ability to change what LDAP attribute the NameID is mapped to on the IdP (SAML Provider) side. In those cases, they need the ability to tell Confluence that the NameID in the SAML response is equal to the email address of said user.

 

The current requirements for NameID in the SAML response are noted in [Saml Single Sign On For Atlassian Data Center Applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/saml-single-sign-on-for-atlassian-data-center-applications-857050705.html]:
{quote}
Make sure the NameID attribute of the users in your IdP is set to the username in your Atlassian application 
{quote}

h2. Workaround
[Using A Saml Assertion Attribute As The Product Username|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/howto-using-a-saml-assertion-attribute-as-the-product-username-945522510.html]
fields.summary: Add the ability to change which user attribute the SAML NameID maps to in Confluence

fields.description:
As part of our work to make Confluence Server simpler and easier to use, we've decided to remove the JUnit Report macro in a future Confluence release. This macro is used to display the results of JUnit tests on a Confluence page and, based on our research, is rarely used.

To find out whether you're currently using this macro head to *Macro Usage* in the admin console. The JUnit Report macro will be listed under *Advanced Macros* if it is in use. 

{panel:title=Atlassian status as of September 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#B2D4FF | titleBGColor=#B2D4FF | bgColor=#EAF1FC}
The JUnit Report macro was removed in Confluence 7.0. Any existing instances of the macro will show 'unknown-macro' on the page. 

To check whether a macro is used in your site, go to General Configuration > Macro Usage. 
{panel}

If you'd like to read more about this change see the [End of support announcement|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/End+of+Support+Announcements+for+Confluence]. 

If you have questions or concerns about this change, please comment on this issue.
fields.summary: Plans to remove JUnit macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The link to the [Recently worked on|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/drafts-149040.html#Drafts-Resumeeditingapagewithunpublishedchanges] page from the  *UNPUBLISHED CHANGES* lozenge's tool tip pop up at the top of a page doesn't link to the correct location if the [Site Homepage|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-the-site-home-page-138140.html] is set to anything other than the dashboard.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the [Site Homepage|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-the-site-home-page-138140.html] to a space or user profile
#* This can be global or user specific
# Make changes to an existing page
# Select *Close* rather than update > *Keep Draft*
# Click the link in the *Recently worked on* link in the *Didn't publish?* dialog:
 !didntpublish.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Expected Results
You'll be taken to the *Recently Worked on* page
 !recentlyworkedon.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
You get sent to your configured home page instead like the Space Home or your User Profile. You can see there was an attempt to add browse to the *Recently Worked on* page via the site homepage in the URL bar:
!recentlyworkedon_test.png|thumbnail!
!recentlyworkedon_profile.png|thumbnail! 

The link for a successful or unsuccessful link is always {{<base-url>/#recently-worked,}} though the results differ:
*Homepage Set to Dashboard*
 !didntpublish_dashboard.png|thumbnail! 

*Homepage Set to Space*
 !didntpublish_testhome.png|thumbnail! 

*Homepage Set to Profile*
 !didntpublish_profilehome.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Click your profile picture > go to *Recently Worked on*
 !recentlyworkedon_profile_link.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Recently worked on" link from "Unpublished Changes" lozenge is incorrect if the dashboard is not the site homepage

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

For compliance reasons, some customers need to have a more restrict list of functionalities that Confluence may allow. In this case, a System Administrator of Confluence, and also a Space administrator, can give any permission he/she needs, without notifying these changes.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create a field to disable "Delete attachments" for all users, which can't be restored by users without the knowledge of others.

h3. Why this is important
 
This is important for security and compliance of an instance.
fields.summary: Disable "Delete Attachment" capability

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # In Global Permission, ensure Anonymous users "Can Use" Confluence
 # Create new Space , eg: SpaceA
 ** Go To Space Tools > Permissions > Edit Permission > Ensure Anonymous Users has "View" Permission 
 ** Create a few test pages in SpaceA
 # Then, create a page containing both Contributors Macro and Contributors Summary Macro
 !LoginUser.png|thumbnail!
 # Logout from Confluence and access the page created in Step 3

 
h2. Expected Behaviour:

Confluence will not shows data and shows message that user is not authorized to see the data from the macro.

 
h2. Actual Behaviour

Contributors Summary Macro shows data when Anonymous user accessing the page while Contributors Macro will throws "
 Failed to retrieve contributors information: Unauthorized" message.
 !AnonUser.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Contributors Summary Macro Shows Data to Anonymous Users

fields.description:
When a client runs the *Log Scanner* in Support Tools in Confluence, the log scanner incorrectly uses the invalid Cookie Header date/timestamp as the date of the log message occurrence. This is naturally confusing to our clients reviewing the log scanner results from STP as the date is *in the future* and is anomalous to anyone who is viewing the result. How can the logs display an event that has not occurred as of the message? Is it foretelling an issue that _will occur_?

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Any Confluence 6.x instance that has actual data, but has a message in the logs similar to below:
{code}
2017-10-16 09:48:11,800 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-1] [http.client.protocol.ResponseProcessCookies] processCookies Invalid cookie header: "Set-Cookie: AWSALB=aHSiOsNJMf/+oKt3+cl+OX9ix58T1dN4W7fLHyUID8Vp5srAIepsnDJ8OJXvOvtDWO0qgvD075W4Yb6DR2fr2cDC+Ggswz11nrCmlQ+fy1Wdqs9c0igtN8JfAe8H; Expires=Mon, 23 Oct 2017 13:48:11 GMT; Path=/". Invalid 'expires' attribute: Mon, 23 Oct 2017 13:48:11 GMT
 -- referer: https://confluence.$CLIENT.com/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?container=atlassian&mid=7714768224256&country=GB&lang=en&view=default&view-params=%7B%22writable%22%3A%22false%22%7D&st=atlassian%3AKwQ4mxwrXWMp%2FMmeIv5EEcdD5B%2BglJvITHwMU06YdolFnOq3spJYr1TX0McPhwH5KK7zGJyqaGasYxBrNM1J7C7c7e5jNE5FI8wTWSYHqFX26JXyHGuto9sPZZMur7y69Hkbgidz4TZSwJa0FdwiGxFLrA6kuTvEM9qCvdK6xKx00gv5PdrsYo4GN3rIXrlAvMRFAxMoUUSZeixBARP1uGNkN%2FoSO%2Fi7rm%2Be4egnobjvle%2Bot7QDefcQOtlAryc4X66yJdzbOpRiN%2FdQ0%2BB8Hsd3zPoRrvtIN8oOqACr5qG%2F42Wf%2BmQ2Te9lhF8CAk2Y%2BinaCyhktm8%2FMt57JsxzhHKVPXegoe2yqv8cXBW%2BAdu%2Bbbmh5VXHSI6yixEZ0LuWiwmfUQ%3D%3D&up_isConfigured=true&up_rapidViewId=409&up_showRapidViewName=false&up_sprintId=30347&up_showSprintName=true&up_refresh=120&url=https%3A%2F%2Fjira.$CLIENT.com%2Frest%2Fgadgets%2F1.0%2Fg%2Fcom.pyxis.greenhopper.jira%3Agreenhopper-gadget-sprint-burndown%2Fgadgets%2Fgreenhopper-sprint-burndown.xml&libs=auth-refresh | url: /plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest | traceId: 7343be298ec45e7d | userName: $userName
{code}
# Run the log scanner with the above message in the logs
# Note the bit of the message that is the problem:
{code}
Expires=Mon, 23 Oct 2017 13:48:11 GMT; Path=/". Invalid 'expires' attribute: Mon, 23 Oct 2017 13:48:11 GMT
{code}
# Although this date has *not yet occurred*, the results show this date
# It appears that the log scanner is seeking the *date* from the line, ignoring that the date here is not the actual date of occurrence, it simply picked up the *second date* in the log line and ignored the first when parsing the complete line of code

h4. Workaround
None known at present, appears that this is a code issue with STP.
fields.summary: Support Tools Plugin incorrectly uses Cookie Expiry as log date

fields.description:
h5. Current behavior
Confluence allocates temporary LOBs but doesn't seem to release/free them if they are no longer used when using *datasource connection*. Therefore the space in the temporary tablespace, which is allocated by such temporary LOBs, is never freed unless the corresponding database session is terminated (e.g. by restarting the application). Over the time the application allocates more and more temporary LOBs and thereby allocates more and more space in the database's temporary tablespace. Since on the other hand, the application doesn't release old/no longer used temporary LOBs, this eventually causes those temporary LOBs to use up all the space available in the database's temporary tablespace.

Increasing the size of the temporary tablespace won't solve this issue. Because no matter how large the temporary tablspace is, if the application continues to allocate new space (by creating new temporary LOBs) without ever freeing some of this space, even the largest temporary tablespace will eventually end up being completely used up. The only thing that can be achieved by increasing the size of the temporary tablespace is to increase the time it takes for that tablespace to eventually run out of space. In other words, a larger temporary tablespace would allow for the application to run for a longer time before hitting the ORA-1652 error, but eventually it would still hit that error - no matter how large the temporary tablespace is.

While restarting the application on a regular schedule (and thereby terminating its database sessions, thus freeing all the space consumed by that sessions' temporary LOBs) might be an acceptable short-term workaround for this issue, it is no acceptable permanent solution. One reason being that doing so might not scale in case of a changed workload (e.g. with a higher workload the application might allocate more temporary LOBs in the same amount of time, which could cause it to hit the ORA-1652 error before it is scheduled to be automatically restarted). Apart from that it it is not exactly common in our organization to regularly re-start applications as a workaround for resource leaks.

h5. Proposed Solution 
A long-term solution for this issue is for the application to programmatically free those temporary LOBs when they are no longer used. One way of doing so in an JDBC application, is invoking the method "java.sql.NClob.free()".

For more details on freeing temporary LOBs please also refer to the following Oracle documents:df

 [^How to Release the Temp LOB Space and Avoid Hitting ORA-1652 (Doc ID 802897.1).pdf][^How to Release Temporary LOB Segments without Closing the JDBC Connection (Doc ID 1384829.1).pdf]
fields.summary: Full Tablespace - no release the Segments in Tablespace on oracle with DataSource connection

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Mail Archives does not index unicode characters correctly aside from Email Subject affecting Search Feature

If there are unicode characters in *From Address*, or the *Content* of the email in the Mail Archive, they are not properly indexed and cannot be searched. 

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.4.1 with the Encoding set correctly
Indexing Language set to *Chinese* (also tried CJK)
{panel:title=application.xml}
{code}
<sun.jnu.encoding>UTF-8</sun.jnu.encoding>
<file.encoding.pkg>sun.io</file.encoding.pkg>
<sun.io.unicode.encoding>UnicodeLittle</sun.io.unicode.encoding>
<file.encoding>UTF-8</file.encoding>
<default-encoding>UTF-8</default-encoding>
{code}
{panel}
{panel:title=Database Encoding}
{code}
postgres=# \l
                                       List of databases
        Name         |  Owner   | Encoding |   Collate   |    Ctype    |   Access privileges
---------------------+----------+----------+-------------+-------------+-----------------------
 conf641             | postgres | UTF8     | en_US.UTF-8 | en_US.UTF-8 |
{code}
{panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup Confluence 6.4.1 with the correct Encoding
# Create a new Space
# In the new space, setup [Mail Archives|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/mail-archives-139502.html] to any email account. In my testing, I tried to setup Yahoo Email Account
# Send an email to the Mail Archive account with _Email Subject_, _Sender Name_, and _Email Content_  in *Chinese Character*.
# Confirm the email is being fetched into Confluence
# In the Search bar, search for any part of the _Sender Name_ or _Email Content_

h3. Expected Results
User can search for the result in Chinese Character

h3. Actual Results
No result can be found if the _Sender Name_ or _Email Content_ is in unicode character (in my test, I tested with Chinese character)
However, Chinese Character in _Email Subject_ can be searched without issue.

h3. Note
In the Mail Archive interface, all of the emails with unicode character Sender and Email Content can still be *displayed correctly*. Only the _Search_ function is being affected

h3. Workaround
No Workaround so far.
fields.summary: Mail Archives does not index unicode characters correctly aside from Email Subject affecting Search Feature

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently Confluence Datacenter has limited functionality, see [Restricted Functions in Confluence Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/restricted-functions-in-confluence-data-center-656408828.html], and does not list the history of scheduled jobs. This requires administrators to query the database if they want to see scheduled job history.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add in full history for scheduled jobs in Confluence Datacenter
fields.summary: Provide history for scheduled jobs in Confluence Datacenter

I think it would be clearer to visually change this to perhaps a 'red open lock' when there are edit restrictions in place. That would differentiate the "No Restrictions" and "Edit Restrictions" states.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence Questions may not preview the correct image when there are multiple images in the same post.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a question.
# Add an answer with {{image1.jpg}} attached.
# Add another answer with {{image2.jpg}} attached.
# Click on {{image1.jpg}}.
# Close the preview and click on {{image2.jpg}}.

h3. Expected Results

{{image1.jpg}} is properly previewed. After closing {{image1.jpg}} and opening {{image2.jpg}}, the latter is also properly previewed.

h3. Actual Results

{{image1.jpg}} is properly previewed. After closing {{image1.jpg}} and opening {{image2.jpg}}, the preview window improperly shows the former image. (see screenshots)

h3. Notes

The issue is similar to CONFSERVER-51987.

h3.Workaround

Refresh the page before clicking on the image.
fields.summary: Confluence Questions may not preview the correct image when there are multiple images in the same post

fields.description: h3. Summary The "Unlink" function which turns a link into a string performs some additional processing on the link to make it conform to a URL format. h3. Environment Confluence 6.1.1 h3. Steps to Reproduce # If you copy a string such as "https://www.mycompany.com//" into a Confluence page, Confluence automatically converts the string into a URL as it is very similar to a URL. In this case, however, this string is not a valid URL as it contains two tags at the end since the purpose of this string is to show the format of a URL used for a particular operation. # While the conversion from a string to a URL is not necessarily a bad thing, if you convert this newly created URL back to plain old text by way of clicking on the URL and then the "Unlink", the Unlink function eliminates the substrings and and leaves a string like this: "https://www.mycompany.com//" h3. Expected Behavior The URL-like string is left intact (eg. "https://www.mycompany.com//"). h3. Actual Behavior The "Unlink" function processes the URL-like string to make it look like a valid URL by changing the original string content. h3. Workaround # If you have the Confluence Source Editor, you can remove the and tags from around the URL after pasting it into the page. # Another approach would be to insert the URL as markup. Then, click on the link portion of the URL and click on Unlink.
fields.summary: Using the Unlink function on URL-like strings

fields.description:
The second option '*With a reverse proxy*' mentioned in this documentation (https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/administering-collaborative-editing-858772086.html#AdministeringCollaborativeEditing-ReverseproxywithinternalSynchronyproxy) does not work with Confluence Data Center.

h2. How to Reproduce
# Configure reverse proxy for CDC application using the standard proxy settings configured within the Tomcat {{server.xml}} file.
{code}
<Connector port="9623" connectionTimeout="20000" redirectPort="8443"
                maxThreads="48" minSpareThreads="10"
                enableLookups="false" acceptCount="10" debug="0" URIEncoding="UTF-8"
                protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol" 
				proxyName="example.com"
				proxyPort="443"
				scheme="https"/>
{code}
# Add the following parameter into the _$CONF_INSTALL/bin/setenv.sh_ file.
{code}CATALINA_OPTS="-Dsynchrony.proxy.enabled=true -Dsynchrony.service.url=http://192.168.1.100:8091/synchrony/v1 ${CATALINA_OPTS}"{code}
# Install Synchrony as a service as per this KB article: https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/run-synchrony-standalone-as-a-service-on-linux-933081078.html
# Configure the Synchrony service URL within the {{start-synchrony.sh}} file so that it matches the following:
{code}-Dsynchrony.service.url=http://192.168.1.100:8091/synchrony{code}
# Start Synchrony using the {{start-synchrony.sh}} file.
# Restart Confluence Data Center.

h2. Expected Behavior
The redirection of https://example.com/synchrony-proxy is handled properly within the Confluence Data Center.

h2. Actual Behavior
The redirection of https://example.com/synchrony-proxy does not work properly with the following observations:
# https://example.com/synchrony-proxy/ returns 404 error.
# http://192.168.1.100:8091/synchrony-proxy loads forever.
# https://example.com/confluence/rest/synchrony-interop/synchrony-status returns the following status.
{code}{"status":"running"}{code}
fields.summary: Synchrony Proxy Does Not Work With Confluence Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, if you use sections and include pages that themselves use sections, there *will* be an horizontal scroll bar in the containing section, even though the included page could fit in the section the macro is declared into.

Example:

You have a main page. This page uses section for it's main body. At the end, you include a a few smaller pages. Those pages use a simple, single section containing two columns. SInce you already used sections in the main page, you have to declare a single-column section for all or each of the included pages.

These pages should have no problem being presented as is, but since they themselves are declared in a section, this creates a superfluous need for spacing in the section that declares the "include page" macro, thus having a needless scroll bar just below each section that includes the macro.

Thus, my feature request is this:

The "include page" macro should have an option to replace the section it is declared into with it's content, if appropriate. SInce it would remove the "section within a section" problem, no scroll bar would appear.
fields.summary: New Feature: Include Page macro to replace section it is declared into.
InvocationTargetException while saving pages with corrupt formatting

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Some customers have a lot of pages on their Confluence instance, and for them, it would be important to show, on the top of all pages, the page's children, instead of showing just on the sidebar.

h3. Suggested Solution

We suggest to place on the top of all pages, the page's children, if they have.

h3. Why this is important

Using macros for this demand is not feasible since the customer would need to go to all the pages and insert the macro, therefore, the implementation of it is necessary.
fields.summary: Show child pages in all pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When adding View restrictions to a parent page, the view restrictions will be inherited by the child pages. However, when adding a new restriction to a child page of the parent, those view restrictions are no longer inherited because they are following the restrictions applied to the specific child page. 

This can be quite confusing for users, because when they go to add edit restrictions to a child page with parent view restrictions, they see the following: 
!child_restriction.png|thumbnail!
"Only some people can edit this page. There are inherited view restrictions"

This serves to confuse users, because this is no longer the case when new restrictions have been added to the sub page.

h3. Suggested Solution
There are two options here: 
# Remove the text that reads "Only some people can edit this page. There are inherited view restrictions" so as not to confuse users. 
# Inherit the view permissions of the parent page, but allow users to modify access on the child page. 

h3. Why this is important
Administrators spend an inordinate amount of time explaining and troubleshooting this. It appears to be a bug, since the message says there are inherited permissions, but when users with access (from the parent page) try to access the sub page, they cannot see it until they have been given explicit access. Moreover, page restrictions serve as a security mechanism and should be made more clear in order to ensure proper lockdown of content.
fields.summary: Improve inherited permissions when restrictions are added to a child page

fields.description:
h3. Description
When user A created a page that only restricted to user A, user B as a confluence admin are able to view the page but the edit button is not appearing. If the user B click the page restriction, it shows that user B have view and edit permission.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Login as userA(normal user) and create a confluence page in a public space.
# Restrict the page to userA only
# Logout as user A and login as the system admin of confluence (UserB)
# Access the space and view the page created by userA
# You will notice you are able to view the page but not able to edit the page.
# Click the lock pad icon
# It will show that userB have the view and edit permission.
(i) Details for the behavior please review the following video.
 [^Recording #36.mp4] 

Expected result
UserB is not listed in the page restriction or UserB can view and seeing the edit button as system admin have the control to view and edit restricted pages

Actual result
UserB is able to view the page but the edit button is not there. This will confuse the user.
fields.summary: Page restriction is showing system admin page have the view and edit permission but there is not edit button

fields.description:
h3. Summary
WebDAV launcher on Firefox  doesn't work  - "one of the following protocols (ms-word) isn't associated with any program" 

h3. Environment
* Operating System (client):  Windows 10 Pro
* os build: 15063.608
* Web browser: Firefox 56.0 (32-bit), 56.0.1 (64-bit), 60.2.0
* Confluence version 6.3.3 (64bit Linux), 6.7.2 (64bit Linux) 
* MS Office Professional 2010 version 14.0.6023.1000

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start Firefox web browser, login to Confluence
# Upload any .doc or .docx document to any Confluence page. Save the page 
# Go to "..." ->  -> Edit In Office  ( choose .doc file created in previous step)
# Install and configure  webdav firefox addon according to [Install the Firefox Add-On for the Office Connector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/install-the-firefox-add-on-for-the-office-connector-170494211.html]

h3. Expected Results
* Document will be opened in MS Word.

h3. Actual Results
* Document will not be opened, following error message is displayed "Firefox doesn't know how to open this address, because one of the following protocols (ms-word) isn't associated with any program or is not allowed in this context."" 


h5. Comments 
* Error will by thrown for other MS Office file formats as well (for example MS Excel .xls)
* It was possible on the same *Environment* to open/edit MS Office file when using Confluence 5.9.3 

h5. Workaround
* Use Internet Explorer 11
fields.summary: WebDAV launcher on Firefox  doesn't work  - "one of the following protocols (ms-word) isn't associated with any program"
